result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Warren Schaller passed away 10/18/18

Defendant Warren J Schaller in court with Attorney Mark Emil Kershek.  Edward M Bremberger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Kershek requests a plea and sentence date as he is waiting for a global offer on all cases.  Court sets this case for jury status and jury trial.   Bail remains as fixed.  Jury status hearing scheduled for August 11, 2016 at 10:30 am.  Jury trial - 12 person scheduled for August 23, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Hearing on June 20, 2016 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Warren J Schaller in court with attorney Mark Emil Kershek.  Shawn N Woller appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Competency report filed. Attorney Kershek does not contest the finding of the report. State agrees. Court will find the Defendant competent to proceed. Attorney Kershek states there is no offer yet, and would reaquest another hearing date to discuss date with charging DA. Court sets.   Bail remains as fixed.  Hearing scheduled for June 20, 2016 at 09:00 am.
(Fax) Dated 05/13/16.
Signed by Judge Carter on 04/27/16.

Defendant Warren J Schaller in court with attorney Mark Emil Kershek.  Lindsey Hirt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense Counsel requests order for competency pursuant to Sec. 971.14(2).  Court grants request and orders the defendant be examined by the Wisconsin Forensic Unit.  To be done as an outpatient basis.  Hearing scheduled for May 16, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Motion to forfeit bail granted.

Defendant Warren J Schaller in court with Attorney Mark Emil Kershek.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern Kelly Pingel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Kershek requests an adjournment as Defendant will be obtaining counseling. Court adjourns.   Bail remains as fixed.  Hearing scheduled for April 18, 2016 at 10:00 am.

Signed by Judge Carter on 02/22/16. Attorney Mark Kershek has been appointed. Atty to be reimbursed for services at the fixed rate of compensation set forth in SCR.81.02(1m) and will be paid by the County of Waukesha upon receipt of a statement of services rendered.
Hearing at 03-18-2016 10:00 am

Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.   Defendant to have no contact with victim/witness listed in the Criminal Complaint.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed. Defendant allowed non collect phone call.

Defendant Warren J Schaller in court, in custody.  Shawn N Woller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant states he fell and does not remember things and that is why he did not comply with WCS.  Defendant did not qualify for public defender representation.  Court orders appointment of counsel for Defendant.  Court holds open issue of repayment of attorney's fees.  Court sets cash bail.  Hearing scheduled for March 18, 2016 at 10:00 am.

Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.   Defendant to have no contact with victim/witness listed in the Criminal Complaint.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed. Defendant allowed non collect phone call.

Defendant is not eligible for State Public Defender representation.  Hearing scheduled for March 1, 2016 at 09:30 am.

Case called at 10:55 a.m.  Defendant Warren J Schaller not in court.  Melissa Zilavy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court issues a capias.  Bail is ordered revoked and forfeited.

Defendant Warren J Schaller in court.  Melissa Zilavy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant requests an adjourned date so he can seek counsel.  Court adjourns.   Bail remains as fixed.  Hearing scheduled for December 14, 2015 at 09:30 am.

Processing.   Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.

Defendant Warren J Schaller in court, in custody, with attorney Eryn M Menden.     Attorney appears as friend of the court. District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is not eligible for State Public Defender representation. Defendant will be hiring private counsel.   NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED BY THE COURT.  Hearing scheduled for November 9, 2015 at 08:30 am.
